revision.text: {{UpdateSitesWarning}}{{UpdateSitesMenu}}== Introduction == The [[Updater]] has a convenient ''Manage update sites'' dialog that is populated by this wiki page. * '''Users:''' You can [[How to follow a 3rd party update site|enable an update site]] using the {{bc | Help | Update...}} command and clicking the "Manage update sites" button. * '''Developers:''' You can add [[How to set up and populate an update site|your own update site]] to this list by [[Special:CreateAccount|registering a wiki account]] and editing the table below yourself. Please maintain alphabetical order, but please do not change the format of the table—you will most likely break the [[updater]] if you do this. == Available update sites == {| class="wikitable" !colspan="4" style="border-bottom: 1px solid gray"|ImageJ Update Sites |- |style="vertical-align: bottom;"|'''Name''' |style="vertical-align: bottom;"|'''Site''' |style="vertical-align: bottom;"|'''Description''' |style="vertical-align: bottom;"|'''Maintainer''' |- valign="top" |'''ImageJ''' |https://update.imagej.net/ |Base update site for Fiji-Stable (along with Fiji and Java-8). No need to add this to your list of update sites; it is already included with Fiji-Stable. |ImageJ2 developers |- valign="top" |'''Fiji''' |https://update.fiji.sc/ |Base update site for Fiji-Stable (along with ImageJ and Java-8). No need to add this to your list of update sites; it is already included with Fiji-Stable. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''ImageJ (Europe mirror)''' |https://downloads.micron.ox.ac.uk/fiji_update/mirrors/imagej/ |European mirror for the ImageJ update site. Replace the ImageJ update site with this one for faster updates in Europe. |ImageJ2 developers |- valign="top" |'''Fiji (Europe mirror)''' |https://downloads.micron.ox.ac.uk/fiji_update/mirrors/fiji/ |European mirror for the Fiji update site. Replace the Fiji update site with this one for faster updates in Europe. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''Fiji-Legacy''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Fiji-Legacy/ |Restores old Fiji plugins which never made the transition to Maven, as well as obsolete libraries no longer used by current Fiji installations. |UNSUPPORTED |- valign="top" |'''Java-8''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Java-8/ |Base update site for Fiji-Stable (along with ImageJ and Fiji). No need to add this to your list of update sites; it is already included with Fiji-Stable. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''Java-8 (Europe mirror)''' |https://downloads.micron.ox.ac.uk/fiji_update/mirrors/java-8/ |European mirror for the Java-8 update site. Replace the Java-8 update site with this one for faster updates in Europe. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''Fiji-Latest''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Fiji/ |Base update site for Fiji-Latest. No need to add this to your list of update sites; it is already included with Fiji-Latest. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''Fiji-Latest (Europe mirror)''' |https://downloads.micron.ox.ac.uk/fiji_update/mirrors/sites-fiji/ |European mirror for the Fiji-Latest update site. Replace the Fiji-Latest update site with this one for faster updates in Europe. |Fiji developers |- valign="top" |'''2015-Conference''' |https://sites.imagej.net/2015-Conference/ |A collection of plugins highlighting the latest features of ImageJ. As seen in Wayne Rasband's opening talk at the 2015 conference! |Curtis Rueden |- valign="top" |'''3D ImageJ Suite''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Tboudier/ |A suite of plugins providing enhanced 3D capabilities in ImageJ. |Thomas Boudier |- valign="top" |'''3Dscript''' |https://romulus.oice.uni-erlangen.de/updatesite/ |3Dscript is a plugin animating 3D/4D microscopy data using a natural-language-based syntax. |Benjamin Schmid |- valign="top" |'''ActogramJ''' |https://romulus.oice.uni-erlangen.de/imagej/updatesites/ActogramJ/ |ActogramJ is a plugin for analyzing actograms. |Benjamin Schmid |- valign="top" |'''AdipoQ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/AdipoQ/ |ImageJ plugins for quantifying adipocyte morphology and function in tissues and in vitro. For more details, a link to the corresponding publication, and information on how to cite the plugins visit the AdipoQ github page https://github.com/hansenjn/AdipoQ/ |Jan Hansen |- valign="top" |'''AIC Janelia - Course''' |https://sites.imagej.net/AICjanelia-course/ |A collection of plugins and macros for students of the Advanced Imaging Center (AIC) Fiji Course. |AIC Janelia |- valign="top" |'''ALPACA''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ALPACA/ |A collection of macros to study cilia. |Torsten Schmenger |- valign="top" |'''AMPT''' |https://sites.imagej.net/AMPT/ |The Aquatic Mammal Photogrammetry Tool (AMPT) is an ImageJ plug-in that simplifies the process of measuring aquatic mammals from aerial imagery. The tool may be configured to support different guided measurements. |AMPT Developers |- valign="top" |'''Angiogenesis''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Angiogenesis/ |A plugin to quantify angiogenic sprout morphology. |Jan Eglinger |- valign="top" |'''AngioTool''' |https://sites.imagej.net/AngioTool/ |The AngioTool software converted to a Fiji plugin. |Jan Eglinger |- valign="top" |'''apoc''' |https://sites.imagej.net/apoc/ |Accelerated pixel and object classifiers (APOC). See clijx-accelerated-pixel-and-object-classification. |Robert Haase |- valign="top" |'''Archipelago''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Lindsey/ |A set of plugins that allow Fiji to be run in parallel on a cluster. Currently, Trainable Weka Segmentation and Elastic Alignment are accelerated in this way. |Larry Lindsey |- valign="top" |'''AxoNet''' |https://sites.imagej.net/AxoNet/ |An implementation of the AxoNet tool which can be used to count axons in light micrographs of optic nerves. |Matthew Ritch |- valign="top" |'''BACMMAN''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BACMMAN/ |BACteria in Mother Machine ANalyzer: a plugin for high-throughput analysis of multichannel mother machine data. See Sources: https://github.com/jeanollion/bacmman and Wiki: https://github.com/jeanollion/bacmman/wiki |Jean Ollion |- valign="top" |'''BACMMAN-DL''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BACMMAN-DL/ |Enables deep learning for BACMMAN (CPU). Currently using Tensorflow 2x |Jean Ollion |- valign="top" |'''BACMMAN-DL-GPU''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BACMMAN-DL-GPU/ |Enables deep learning for BACMMAN (GPU). Currently using Tensorflow 2x |Jean Ollion |- valign="top" |'''BAR''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Tiago/ |BAR (Broadly Applicable Routines) is a GitHub-curated collection of scripts that simplifies the daily usage of ImageJ. The collection is focused on Data Analysis, Image Annotation and Segmentation. |Tiago Ferreira |- valign="top" |'''BaSiC''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BaSiC/ |BaSiC is a retrospective image correction method for optical microscopy, available as a Fiji/ImageJ Plugin. It is based on low rank and sparse decomposition, which corrects both shading (uneven illumination) in space and background bleaching in time. |Tingying Peng |- valign="top" |'''Batch Composite''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BatchComposite/ |Batch Composite is a small plugin that runs the Composite operation on a folder of openable files. It supports Bio-Formats, recursion, and color customization. |Kevin Fisher |- valign="top" |'''Batch Tools''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BatchTools/ |Batch Tools provides a toolbar to support batch image processing and analysis, including batch extract, merge channels, composite conversion, Z-projection, channel B&C and colour adjustment, file export, and cell count, gray value & area measurement. |Neville S Ng |- valign="top" |'''BD-CellView''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BD-CellView/ |BD-CellView enables inspection and batch processing of images generated with the BD-CellView imaging flow cytometer. |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''BIG-EPFL''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BIG-EPFL/ |ImageJ plugins from EPFL's Biomedical Imaging Group (BIG). NOT OPEN SOURCE. |Curtis Rueden |- valign="top" |'''BigDataProcessor''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BigDataProcessor/ |BigDataProcessor2 is an Imglib2 and BigDataViewer based tool for inspection and processing of big (TB-sized) image data. |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''BigStitcher''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BigStitcher/ |Based on the HDF5 multi-resolution datastructures of the BigDataViewer the BigStitcher uses globally optimal registration that is capable of aligning large multi-tile datasets with high precision and automatic error detection within just a few minutes while at the same time allowing for additional user interaction. |Stephan Preibisch, David Hörl |- valign="top" |'''BigVolumeViewer Demo''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BigVolumeViewer/ |Demo of BDV volume rendering. See this forum post for getting started. |Tobias Pietzsch |- valign="top" |'''Bio-Formats''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Bio-Formats/ |A version of Bio-Formats with the latest bugfixes from the development branch. The last SNAPSHOTS are automatically uploaded daily. |OME development team |- valign="top" |'''Biomat''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Biomat/ |Plugins for 3D image preprocessing and detection of fibres in 3D image. |Jiri Janacek |- valign="top" |'''Biomedgroup''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Biomedgroup/ |A set of plugins developed by the biomedical imaging group of the dortmund university of applied sciences and arts: * Shape Filter (Filter binary images by shape), * Shape Smoothing (Smooth objects via Fourier descriptors), * Non Local Means Denoise (edge preserving noise filter), * NanoTrackJ (Size characterization of freely diffusing nanoparticles by particle tracking), * Ridge Detection (Line / Ridge detection plugin). |Thorsten Wagner |- valign="top" |'''BioVoxxel''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BioVoxxel/ |A toolset providing a plugins and macros for flat-field background corrections, image filters, color coding of shape descriptors and several tools to process and analyze binary images such as the 'Speckle Inspector', 'Binary Feature Extractor' and an 'Extended Particle Analyzer' and a qualitative and quantitative evaluation tool for Fijis' Auto Threshold methods. More information at the BioVoxxel Toolbox page and the BioVoxxel web site. |Jan Brocher |- valign="top" |'''BioVoxxel 3D Box''' |https://sites.imagej.net/bv3dbox/ |Image processing and analysis tools for 2D and 3D images in one place. Based on GPU accelerated computing via CLIJ2. BioVoxxel 3D box BioVoxxel web site. |Jan Brocher |- valign="top" |'''BioVoxxel Figure Tools''' |https://sites.imagej.net/bvft/ |The figure tools are meant to connect Fiji with Inkscape to flexibly prepare images for and create publication figures with the highest possible data quality. An introduction video to version 2.2.0 can be found here |Jan Brocher |- valign="top" |'''Blind Analysis Tools''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Astja/ |Tools to facilitate blind i.e., unbiased analysis of (image) data. For more information visit the documentation page. |Astha Jaiswal, Holger Lorenz |- valign="top" |'''BoneJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BoneJ/ |A collection tools for trabecular geometry and whole bone shape analysis. This update site hosts the new experimental, modernized version of BoneJ that works with the latest Fiji. Enabling the update site creates the menu entries Plugins > BoneJ. The pQCT tools are now hosted on their own update site (see below). |Michael Doube, Alessandro Felder |- valign="top" |'''BTrack''' |https://sites.imagej.net/BTrack/ |BTrack uses the skeletonization implementation of ImgLib2 to track growing ends of tissue branches. It is suitable for any form of imaging modality as it requires a segmentation image as an input for performing the tracking operations. |Varun Kapoor |- valign="top" |'''CALM''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CALM/ |Plugins from the Crick Advanced Light Microscopy Facility at The Francis Crick Institute. |David Barry |- valign="top" |'''CAMDU''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CAMDU/ |Plugins from the Computing and Advanced Microscopy Development Unit at the University of Warwick. |Erick Martins Ratamero |- valign="top" |'''CATS''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CATS/ |Context Aware Trainable Segmentation CATS |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''CellTrackingChallenge''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Ulman/ |Implementation of measures and front-end Fiji plugins used in and related to the Cell Tracking Challenge. It also provides an extension for importing, editing and exporting the results of the CellTrackingChallenge, which can be used in conjunction with the Mastodon plugin. |Vladimír Ulman |- valign="top" |'''Cellular Imaging''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Cellular-Imaging/ |Fiji plugins developed in the Cellular Imaging - Lehmann Group of the FMP-Berlin. |Christopher Schmied |- valign="top" |'''CiliaQ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CiliaQ/ |An set of three ImageJ plugins to quantify ciliary shape, length, and fluorescence in 2D, 3D, and 4D images. For more details, a link to the corresponding publication, and information on how to cite the plugin visit the CiliaQ github pages (including manual and wiki) at https://github.com/hansenjn/CiliaQ |Jan Hansen |- valign="top" |'''CIP''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CIP/ |An image processing toolbox focused on scripting. |Benoit Lombardot |- valign="top" |'''CircleSkinner''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CircleSkinner/ |A Fiji plugin for the automated detection and quantification of circular structures in images. |Jean-Yves Tinevez |- valign="top" |'''ClearVolume''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ClearVolume/ |ClearVolume is a fast 3D viewer, for more information see also the ClearVolume wiki. |ClearVolume |- valign="top" |'''clij''' |https://sites.imagej.net/clij/ |GPU-acceleration for ImageJ. See https://clij.github.io/ |Robert Haase |- valign="top" |'''clij2''' |https://sites.imagej.net/clij2/ |GPU-acceleration for ImageJ. Please also activate "clij" if you want to use "clij2". See https://clij.github.io/ |Robert Haase |- valign="top" |'''clijx-assistant''' |https://sites.imagej.net/clijx-assistant/ |Experimental update site for the future release of clij2. See https://clij.github.io/assistant |Robert Haase |- valign="top" |'''clijx-assistant-extensions''' |https://sites.imagej.net/clijx-assistant-extensions/ |Experimental update site for the future release of clij2. See https://clij.github.io/assistant |Robert Haase |- valign="top" |'''CMCI-EMBL''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Miura/ |A plugin for loading sample images and misc functionality for CMCI ImageJ course. See CMCI course. Eventually more plugins will be added. |Kota Miura |- valign="top" |'''CMP-BIA tools''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CMP-BIA/ |The development version of CMP-BIA tools. |Jiri Borovec |- valign="top" |'''CMTK Registration''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Jefferis/ |CMTK Registration GUI. |Gregory Jefferis |- valign="top" |'''Colocalization by Cross Correlation''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Amccall/ |A co-localization plugin that attempts to find non-random spatial correlations between two images and provide an estimate of their distance and standard deviation. Conceptually similar to Van Steensel's CCF. For more details see our wiki page. |Andrew McCall |- valign="top" |'''ColonyArea''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ColonyArea/ |A plugin that is optimized to perform standard analysis of colony formation assays conducted in 6- to 24-well dishes. The plugin processes each well individually and determines not the colony number, but the area of the well covered with cells, also taking the intensity into account. |Turku BioImaging, Junel Solis |- valign="top" |'''ColorBlindLUTs''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ColorBlindLUTs/ |ColorBlindLUTs is a set of color blind friendly lookup tables for Fiji/ImageJ. |Bruno C. Vellutini |- valign="top" |'''Colour Deconvolution2''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ColourDeconvolution2/ |Update site for Colour Deconvolution2 |Gabriel Landini |- valign="top" |'''Cookbook''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Cookbook/ |Plugins from the Cookbook. |Cookbook Team |- valign="top" |'''CSBDeep''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CSBDeep/ |Plugins for executing pretrained CARE networks. |Deborah Schmidt |- valign="top" |'''CSIM Laboratory''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Acsenrafilho/ |A set of plugins, macros and scripts developed by the CSIM (Computing in Signal and Images in Medicine) research group. One of the methods available are Anomalous Diffusion Filters, Noise Generator, MRI Perfusion and the Sample Entropy for Images. Please, see the CSIM group web page to find out how the methods works and more information about us. |Antonio Carlos da S. Senra Filho |- valign="top" |'''CWNS dense nuclei segmenter''' |https://sites.imagej.net/CWNS/ |The Fiji implementation of the CWNS dense nuclei segmenter, presented in "Object Segmentation and Ground Truth in 3D Embryonic Imaging", by B. Rajasekaran et al., Plos ONE, 2016. |Jean-Yves Tinevez |- valign="top" |'''DeepClas4Bio-plugins''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Adines/ |Collection of plugins that use DeepClas4Bio API -- an API that facilitates the interoperability of bioimaging tools with deep learning frameworks. |Adrián Inés |- valign="top" |'''DeepImageJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/DeepImageJ/ |Bioimage processing using (pre-)trained deep learning models from TensorFlow or PyTorch. The collection of deepImageJ plugins enables the interaction with the BioImage Model Zoo. Further details are available in the deepImageJ web page. |Estibaliz Gómez de Mariscal, Daniel Sage, Arrate Muñoz-Barrutia |- valign="top" |'''Dendrite Dynamics Tracker''' |https://sites.imagej.net/DendriteDynamicsTracker/ |Dendrite-Dynamics-Tracker is a plugin based on TrackMate and AnalyzeSkeleton that can measure the dynamics of dendrites by tracking their tip over time. |Jean-Yves Tinevez |- valign="top" |'''DHM Utilities''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Sudgy/ |Collection of plugins for use in digital holographic microscopy, such as hologram reconstruction, numerical propagation, and phase unwrapping. |David Cohoe |- valign="top" |'''DHPSFU''' |https://sites.imagej.net/DHPSFU/ |DHPSFU provides a suite of tools for analysing 3D SMLM/SPT data obtained using Double Helix (DH) PSF microscopy based on unmixing (DHPSFU) of fitted localisation data using distance pairing. |Ziwei Zhang, The Laue Lab |- valign="top" |'''DiameterJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/DiameterJ/ |Macros for quantitative analysis of nanofiber images. DiameterJ is able to analyze any network of connecting lines (validated for SEM micrographs of micro- and nanofibers) and produce metrics such as mean diameter, histograms of fiber diameter, mean pore size, histogram of all pore areas, percent porosity, etc. See soon for more information and the publication describing how DiameterJ works and its limitations. |Nathan Hotaling |- valign="top" |'''DiversePathsJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Vuhlmann/ |DiversePathsJ implements a dynamic programming approach for the general task of finding diverse shortest paths between two end-points. It is not linked to a specific biological problem and can be applied to a large variety of images. See the DiversePathsJ web page for more information. |Virginie Uhlmann |- valign="top" |'''DNA FISH''' |https://sites.imagej.net/DNA-FISH/ |Plugin for semi-automated analysis of DNA FISH spots. |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''Draw 3D ROI''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Draw3DROI/ |A Fiji plugin to create 3D masks from hand-drawn 2D ROIs. |Andrew McCall |- valign="top" |'''ElastixWrapper''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ElastixWrapper/ |Image registration using elastix |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''ELEPHANT''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ELEPHANT/ |ELEPHANT is a platform for 3D cell tracking, based on incremental and interactive deep learning. ELEPHANT is implemented as a plugin for Mastodon. Please not that users need to set up the ELEPHANT server in addition to this plugin. The detailed instructions can be found here. |Ko Sugawara |- valign="top" |'''EM Tool''' |https://sites.imagej.net/IMBalENce/ |EM tool is a suite of simple tools for electron microscopist |Zhou Xu |- valign="top" |'''EpiGraph''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Pedgomgal1/ |EpiGraph: an open-source method to quantify epithelial organization. EpiGraph is a Fiji plugin that combines computational geometry and graph theory to measure organization in any computational or natural tessellation image. |Pedro J. Gómez Gálvez, Pablo Vicente Munuera |- valign="top" |'''EVAnalyzer''' |https://sites.imagej.net/evanalyzer/ |EVAnalyzer EVAnalyzer is a Fiji ImageJ plugin designed for analyzing microscope pictures of EVs. This plugin can be used for: Counting the number of EVs; Calculating the colocalization of evs and other particles; Detect biological cells and counting EVs updatekn from cells; Analysis of a large amount of images automatically;Generating XLSX (Excel) reports with automatic statistics generation. |Joachim Danmayr |- valign="top" |'''Excel Functions''' |https://sites.imagej.net/ExcelMacroExtensions/ |The Excel Functions and Excel Macro Extensions are meant to build an interface beween ImageJ and Excel (.xlsx). It serves as a library which can be used via the ImageJ macro language, Java and Jython to facilitate data transfer Excel Macro Extensions. |Jan Brocher |- valign="top" |'''EZFig''' |https://sites.imagej.net/EZF/ |EZFig is a tool to build publication-ready scientific figures based on ScientiFig but simpler to use. It must be used in combination with the 'Java-8' update site. |Benoit Aigouy |- valign="top" |'''FAST''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FAST/ |Fluorescence image AnalysiS Tool automates tasks to process a set of single-channel fluorescence images. |C.TURIÈS |- valign="top" |'''FAST-HIPPOS''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FAST-HIPPOS/ |FAST-HIPPOS (FLIM Analysis of Single-cell Traces for Hit Identification of Phenotypes in Pooled Optical Screening) is a collection of macros to analyze time-lapse live-cell (FLIM) data, and to automatically identify hit cells and save their microscope stage coordinates to a file readable by Leica LAS X Navigator. |Bram van den Broek |- valign="top" |'''Fast4DReg''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Fast4DReg/ |Fast4DReg is a Fiji macro for drift correction of 3D videos or channel alignment in 3D multichannel image stacks. Drift or misalignment can be corrected in all x-, y- and/or z-directions. |Joanna Pylvänäinen |- valign="top" |'''FFMPEG''' |https://fiji.sc/~schindelin/ffmpeg-plugins/ |Fiji plugins which allow reading and writing to FFmpeg-supported formats via native bindings. |Curtis Rueden |- valign="top" |'''FFmpegVideoImportExport''' |https://sites.imagej.net/VideoImportExport/ |The FFmpegVideoImportExport allows to import compressed video files into a virtual stack or hyperstack and export a stack as compressed video file using JavaCV interface to FFmpeg. |Stanislav Chizhik |- valign="top" |'''FibrilJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FibrilJ/ |Macros developed to measure the diameters and persistence lengths if amyloids fibrils by AFM, EM, STM etc. iamges. It provides histogram distribution of the average fibril diameter and average fibril persistence length. Was validated for AFM, SEM and TEM images of Sup35NM fibrils on mica, silicon, gold surfaces and formvar film. |Petr Sokolov |- valign="top" |'''Filopodyan''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Rb7777/ |Filopodia dynamics analysis. See GitHub for the user guide, source code and R scripts for downstream analysis. |Richard Butler, Vasja Urbančič |- valign="top" |'''FiloQuant''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FiloQuant/ |FiloQuant is a user friendly and modifiable tool for automated detection and quantification of filopodia properties such as length and density. FiloQuant can also track filopodia. |Guillaume Jacquemet, Alexandre Carisey |- valign="top" |'''FiubaMate''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FiubaMate/ |FiubaMate is a detection and tracking system for bodies in channels, built for 'Medios Porosos' lab, FIUBA. |Julian Ferres, Franco Giordano |- valign="top" |'''FLIMJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FLIMJ/ |FLIMJ is a plugin for analyzing FLIM data in ImageJ, using the FLIMLib library. Requires Fiji-Latest. |Edward Evans, Curtis Rueden |- valign="top" |'''FlyReg''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FlyReg/ |FlyReg is a plugin for the 3D registration of fly (drosophila) embryos. |Christian Tischer |- valign="top" |'''Foci Analyzer''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Foci-Analyzer/ |Foci Analyzer is a user-friendly and extensive Fiji macro designed to detect, analyze and visualize foci in 2D and 3D fluorescence microscopy images of cells and tissue. The script utilizes deep-learning tools StarDist and Cellpose for accurate 2D/3D segmentation of cells or nuclei. Advanced libraries like CLIJ2 and MorpholobJ are employed for efficient and reliable foci detection across different imaging modalities (confocal, widefield) and resolutions, with minimal user input. |Bram van den Broek |- valign="top" |'''FOCUST''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FOCUST/ |FOCUST is the Fluorescent Object and Cell gpU-accelerated Segmentation Toolbox. |Sebastian Amos |- valign="top" |'''FPBioimage''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Fpbioimage/ |A plugin to prepare and upload data for Fpbioimage. |FPBioimage |- valign="top" |'''FracLac Suite''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Akarperien/ |Fractal Analysis and Modelling tools for neuroscience and other disciplines. Analysis: DB, lacunarity, multifractal spectra, DLC, DMvD, subscanning, and graphical wave analysis for binary and gray scale images, with inline and online theoretical and practical help. Outputs: detailed analyses, raw data, plots, colour-coding, and settings (*.fl) files. Modelling: benchmark fractals, natural structures (e.g., neurons), megadata to graphical wave images. Code in jar. See citations. |A. Karperien |- valign="top" |'''FreQ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FreQ/ |An ImageJ plugin to analyze pixel intensity oscillations in time-lapse 2D images. For example, this allows to characterize the ciliary beat of multi-ciliated cells in time-lapse images acquired with a bright-field or phase-contrast microscope. For more details, a link to the corresponding publication, and information on how to cite the plugin visit the FreQ github pages at https://github.com/hansenjn/FreQ |Jan Hansen |- valign="top" |'''FRET Imaging''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FRET-Imaging/ |ImageJ plugins for 3-cube FRET (RiFRET) and acceptor photobleaching FRET (AccPbFRET) from CellMoTher. |Cameron Lloyd |- valign="top" |'''FunImageJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/FunImageJ/ |Fiji plugin that provides Clojure wrappings of many commonly used functions from ImageJ and ImgLib2. Works with SciJava scripting for Clojure. FunImageJ scripts can be converted into standalone ImageJ/Fiji-based programs. Code available on GitHub. |Kyle Harrington |- valign="top" |'''Fuzzy logic and artificial neural networks image processing toolbox for ImageJ''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Astartes91/ |Toolbox includes fuzzy edge detection plugin, fuzzy contrast enhancement plugin and ann edge detection plugin. Source code on GitHub. |Vladimir Nizamutdinov |- valign="top" |'''Fuzzy Set''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Rerger/ |Fuzzy Set is an ImageJ plugin, to transform the intensity of the image using Fuzzy Sets. |Robert Erger |- valign="top" |'''GDSC''' |https://sites.imagej.net/GDSC/ |The Genome Damage and Stability Centre (GDSC) plugins are a collection of analysis programs for microscopy images including colocalisation analysis and peak finding (FindFoci). See GDSC Plugins for details. |Alex Herbert |- valign="top" |'''GDSC-SMLM2''' |https://sites.imagej.net/GDSC-SMLM2/ |Tools for Single Molecule Light Microscopy (SMLM) including PALM, STORM and other single molecule microscopy methods. See the latest documentation on ReadTheDocs. |Alex Herbert |- valign="top" |'''Gut Analysis Toolbox''' |https://sites.imagej.net/GutAnalysisToolbox/ |Gut Analysis Toolbox enables semi-automated analysis of the neuronal and glial distribution within the gut wall in 2D. It uses a combination of Fiji macros, StarDist and deepImageJ for automated segmentation. The primary focus is on characterising the enteric nervous system. The aim is to expand the analysis to other celltypes within the gut and enable 3D analysis. |Pradeep Rajasekhar |- valign="top" |'''Hadim''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Hadim/ |Contains the ij2-python-lib package. |Hadrien Mary |- valign="top" |'''HDF5''' |https://sites.imagej.net/Ronneber/ |The HDF5 plugin allows to load and save data in HDF5 format.
